Metadata.Title: Use SSL Or IPSec for Secure Communication Between Entities
Metadata.DirectLink: Use SSL Or IPSec for Secure Communication Between Entities
Metadata.Priority: J.D. Meier, Alex Mackman, Blaine Wastell, Prashant Bansode, Andy Wigley, Kishore Gopalan

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • ASP.NET 2.0 

What to Do

Use an encrypted communication channel to protect data sent between servers. SSL and IPSec can both be used under different circumstances to protect the communication traffic between servers.  

Why

Servers may not necessarily co-exist in a secure environment. If the communication between two or more servers is not protected, the data sent between them could be compromised via eavesdropping or data manipulation.

When

If your servers are not inside a physically secure data center where the network eavesdropping threat is considered insignificant.

How

  1. Determine the level of desired granularity for the given server/application suite.
  2. if the protection needs to be applied across all applications, use IPSec.
  3. if the protection is granular and only a certain portion of the information exchanged between servers is sensitive use SSL

SSL and IPSec can both be used to help protect communication between servers by encrypting traffic. There are benefits to using a mixed approach consisting of both SSL and IPSec. See the related guidelines for specific details.
